Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: The patient expresses a desire to explore stress management techniques due to increasing busyness with the kids' schedules.
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient reports improvements in mood and routine through meditation and journaling, though consistency remains a challenge. They have faced difficulties with bedtime routines due to children's activities but are finding ways to adapt.
Physiological Observations: The patient has implemented a bedtime routine that includes turning off screens and reading, leading to improved alertness and reduced grogginess in the mornings.
Progress Evaluation: The patient shows significant progress in managing emotions and routines, utilizing effective communication with their children.
Therapeutic Interventions: The plan includes discussing stress management techniques in the next session.
Next Steps: The patient will aim to journal after meditation and adjust bedtime on busy days to maintain rest.
